rComments: Class was very very easy. Tests are all essays or short response questions and are super easy if you pay attention to her lectures and go to section. She gets flustered often and is kind of awkward but is very passionate about Central America and the issues the people there face. Just do the readings (or at least skim them)

She started off the class with a bad attitude, that "since this is an 80 series class" we are all unmotivated and uninterested in the class. To be honest, this was in fact true for me and most of the class. However, I feel that this was a horrible way to approach the situation. Boring lectures, boring readings, she drones on and on

I rated her clarity a 1 because I have no idea why she is on a college campus teaching. The class is dry and uninteresting. There is a lot of reading which is directly referenced in the exams but study groups help out with that. Bring headphones or earplugs, shes BORING!

She would frequently post the readings after she said she would, but would expect you to still have them done by the time class started. She gave us our final prompt late and switched it from 3 essays to 4 without saying anything. She also goes off on tangents a lot when lecturing.

Horrible Professor. As an LALS student I am ashamed to have her associated with the department. This class was painfully boring. The majority of the class would spend their time on their phones and computers either surfing the web or playing games. During lecture she just talked and did not make the material accessible or make the connections clear

This class is super interesting and really easy. It is a lower division class, yet I still learned a lot and really enjoyed going. Her lectures are pretty dry and boring, but if you go to section and do the readings you will get an A. There are two response papers, and tests are blue book essays. Not too much reading and none of it is challenging.

Interesting class that focuses on El Salvador, that is her field of research. She is knowledgeable of her field, but seems to have some difficulty answering questions. Great class for a GE, not hard at all, readings are really interesting.

She's a fun teacher. She's very knowledgable, and provides much work and interest. She's a great professor. There is a reading, but not much as other teachers. Her tests aren't difficult, if you do the reading. Great Class!

She's generally nice enough and respectful to her students, and you can tell she's spent a lot of time in this field. But she's very lecture-heavy, it was really hard to pay attention most of the time (not that you needed to most of the time). She also focused too much on El Salvador; I learned little about anywhere else. Not too terrible, though.

Didn't learn anything.  She was really boring to listen to, and her tests were so easy that nobody studied for them.  She lectures the whole time, doesn't ask the class questions, and then gets mad when we don't do the reading.  She gave us fifth-grade homework as a buffer for our grades.  Overall, bad experience, especially for a college course.

Classroom was really boring professor lacked motivation. Attendance was mandatory although it was not necessary because I didn't learn anything the whole back side of the class was sleeping. Although she seems like a nice person it seems like she was always P-M-Sing all she spoke about was el salvador because shes from there. Overall waste of time!

Cecilia Rivas is a good instructor although she can get a little stressed out. SHE IS ALWAYS THERE WILLING TO HELP JUST DO NOT APPROACH HER TOO MUCH SHE DOES NOT LIKE THAT. tHE CLASS IS VERY INTERSETING, BUT HER ENTHUSIAM TO TECH THE CLASS IS SOMEWAY NEUTRAL. SHE HAS DIFICULTIES ANSWERING QUESTIONS.

Professor Rivas is a pretty good teacher.  The subject matter was interesting, and she was well informed about it, but sometimes she doesn't make a lot of sense.  Her tests aren't very difficult, but do involve mainly writing short answers/essays.  She is really nice, just a little flustered sometimes.

She was very nice and approachable and seemed passionate about her subject. Her lectures strayed a little from the topic and she sometimes had trouble answering student's questions, but not in a rude way. class was not challenging whatsoever

Although the material presented in lecture was interesting, the manner in which the professor lectured was almost unbearable. She seems to just ramble on about many different aspects of a concept without actually engaging the concept in any meaningful way which would help in our 3 essays or 2 tests. Thanks to my TA and myself, I still managed an A.
